author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Triumph Amidst the Rubble: L.A. Tunnel Workers Escape Collapse | Science-Environment
text:
Triumph Amidst the Rubble: L.A. Tunnel Workers Escape Collapse
Thirty-one construction workers escaped safely after a portion of a tunnel collapsed in Los Angeles. Workers climbed over loose soil to safety, with no major injuries reported. Authorities are investigating the cause. The tunnel project, costing nearly $700 million, remains halted until deemed safe.
Devdiscourse News Desk| Los Angeles | Updated: 10-07-2025 13:33 IST | Created: 10-07-2025 13:33 IST
- Country:
- United States
A remarkable escape unfolded in Los Angeles when thirty-one construction workers emerged unscathed from a collapsed portion of a vast industrial tunnel. Officials hailed it as a blessing, given earlier fears of a much worse outcome.
The incident, monitored by the Los Angeles County Sanitation Districts, happened at a distance from the tunnel's primary entrance. Workers navigated through over 19 meters of loose soil to reach safety, aided by aerial rescues.
No significant injuries were reported. Investigations into the collapse are ongoing, and work on the $700 million project is suspended until further safety evaluations are conducted. Authorities praised the workers' calm efficiency during the ordeal.

author: RBC-Ukraine
title: Russia attacks Ukraine with Shaheds again - Where were they spotted | RBC-Ukraine
text: Russia attacks Ukraine with Shaheds again: Where were they spotted Today, on December 28, in the evening, Russian occupants again launched Shahed kamikaze drones across Ukraine. They were spotted in the east and south of the country, report the [Air Forces](https://t.me/kpszsu/8983) of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. According to the Air Force, some of the drones are spotted in Sumy region. They are flying in the direction of the Chernihiv region. At the same time, the movement of the Shaheds was spotted in the Kherson region. Drones are heading to Mykolaiv region. Kamikaze drones are also flying over the Black Sea in the direction of Odesa region. Attacks by Shaheds As a reminder, the Russian occupiers regularly use Shahed kamikaze drones in their attempts to attack Ukraine. The enemy usually launches drones at night to complicate the work of the Ukrainian air force. The last attack by the Russians was tonight, December 28. In total, the [enemy launched eight drones](https://newsukraine.rbc.ua/news/night-drone-attack-in-ukraine-air-force-announced-1703741540.html). Ukrainian air defense forces - fighter aircraft, anti-aircraft missile units, and mobile fire groups - managed to shoot down seven Russian drones.

author: Yeni Şafak
title: Georgian premier hosts iftar dinner for Muslim community in capital | Asia
text:
Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze hosted an iftar or fast-breaking dinner Thursday in the capital Tbilisi in observance of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.
The event was attended by Muslim diplomats and politicians as well as officials from the Administration of All Muslims of Georgia, according to a statement by the Georgian Prime Ministry.
Türkiye's Ambassador to Georgia Ali Kaan Orbay was among the guests.
Speaking at the event, Kobakhidze said the Muslims living in the country have made significant contributions to the development and progress of Georgia.
"The Muslim community, which is an integral part of us, has made great contributions to the development of our country, and there is a deep-rooted history behind our brotherhood," he said.
Underling that the government continues to support the Muslim community in Georgia, he said: "The state has handed over 237 mosques to the Muslim community, and 20 more mosques are expected to be handed over.”
“While the state has increased its funding for the Muslim community to nearly 50 million Turkish liras ($1.5 million), this support will further increase with economic growth," Kobakhidze added.
# Georgia # Irakli Kobakhidze # iftar dinner
